keyMoments.title: Fujitora's First Appearance as Blind Gambler
keyMoments.description: A mysterious blind man in simple robes encounters Zoro in the streets of Dressrosa and politely asks for directions to a gambling house. He carries a cane concealing a sword and has a calm, dignified presence.
keyMoments.significance: First introduction of one of the two new Marine Admirals recruited during the timeskip. His humble appearance and blindness conceal his true identity and immense power.
keyMoments.quote: Excuse me, young man. Could you direct me to the nearest gambling establishment?

keyMoments.title: Zoro Senses Fujitora's Unusual Presence
keyMoments.description: After giving directions, Zoro pauses and looks back at the blind man with a serious expression, his instincts telling him something is unusual about this person despite his harmless appearance.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that even disguised, Fujitora's powerful aura can be sensed by strong fighters. Establishes the connection between these two swordsmen that will develop throughout the arc.

keyMoments.title: Fujitora Cheated at Gambling
keyMoments.description: At a restaurant casino, Fujitora sits at a roulette table where three of Doflamingo's thugs recognize his blindness and begin cheating him, manipulating the game to steal his money while mocking his disability.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Fujitora's character and philosophy - he allows himself to be cheated, perhaps testing the morality of those around him or gathering information about Dressrosa's true nature.

relationships.description: Their first meeting in Dressrosa, where Zoro gives Fujitora directions but senses something unusual about the blind man.

evolutionMoments.description: Fujitora asks Zoro for directions. Zoro's instincts tell him this blind man is no ordinary person.

reveals.information: Introduced as a blind gambler in Dressrosa
Completely blind, relying on other senses and potentially Observation Haki
